original: Alvsten, Bengt Harry Clarence, jur. o. fil. kand., borgmästare, Oskarshamn, f. 27/11/92 i Alem, Kalmar I, av lant-br. Per Gustaf Gustafsson o. Alma Svensson. G. 22 m. Anna Carlsson. Barn: Harald f. 23, Bengt-Erik 34, Gunnar 36. — Stud:ex. i Kalmar 13, fil. kand. i Upps. 18, jur. kand. i Sthlm 21. E. o. tj :man v. sv. leg. i Leningrad 17, e. o. not. i Göta hovr. 22, t.ings’tjg. 22-26, tf. fiiskal i Göta hovr. 26, stadsfiskal i 0:skarshamn 28, förste rådm. där 31, tilhka not. publ, tf. borgmäst. und. vakans i Oskarshamn fr. 33, borgmäst. där sed. 42. Ordf. i Borgholms stadsstyr. 22-25, insp. f. yrkessk. i Oskarshamn, led. av styr. f. 0’s kars hamns ,sämre al sk., led. av styr. f. A-B Sv. Hand:bankens avd:kont. i Oskarshamn sed. 34.
translated: Alvsten, Bengt Harry Clarence, law and arts graduate, mayor, Oskarshamn, born on November 27, 1892 in Alem, Kalmar I, son of farmer Per Gustaf Gustafsson and Alma Svensson. Married Anna Carlsson on the 22nd of an unknown month. Children: Harald (born in 1923), Bengt-Erik (born in 1934), Gunnar (born in 1936). He graduated from high school in Kalmar in 1913, obtained a degree in arts in Uppsala in 1918, and a degree in law in Stockholm in 1921. He was an assistant and attaché at the Swedish legation in Leningrad in 1917, acted as acting notary in Göta Court of Appeal in 1922, served in various court positions from 1922 to 1926, acted as a temporary prosecutor in Göta Court of Appeal in 1926, became the city prosecutor in Oskarshamn in 1928, served as the first councilor there in 1931, acted as joint notary public and temporary mayor in Oskarshamn from 1933, and became the mayor there since 1942. He was the chairman of Borgholm’s town council from 1922 to 1925, inspector of vocational schools in Oskarshamn, member of the board of directors of Oskarshamn’s Poorhouse, and also a member of the board of directors of the Swedish Handelsbanken's Oskarshamn branch since 1934.
